org.jsimpledb.annotation

Annotation Type JSimpleClass


  • @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
@Target(value=TYPE)
@Documented
public @interface JSimpleClass
    Java annotation for Java classes that are JSimpleDB object model types.

    Typically such classes are declared abstract and contain abstract Java bean getter methods with @JField, @JSetField, etc. annotations that define the fields of the object type.

    The following annotations are supported on the methods of a @JSimpleClass-annotated class:

    • @link JField @JField} - defines a simple value or reference field
    • @link JSetField @JSetField} - defines a NavigableSet field
    • @link JListField @JListField} - defines a List field
    • @link JMapField @JMapField} - defines a NavigableMap field
    • @link OnChange @OnChange} - annotates a method to be invoked when some field (possibly seen through a path of references) changes
    • @link OnCreate @OnCreate} - annotates a method to be invoked just after object creation
    • @link OnDelete @OnDelete} - annotates a method to be invoked just prior to object deletion
    • @link OnVersionChange @OnVersionChange} - annotates a method to be invoked when the object's schema version changes
    These annotations may be present on any overridden supertype method, including methods in superclasses that are not annotated with @JSimpleClass, and interface methods.

    The subclass of the annotated class that is generated by JSimpleDB will implement JObject, so the (abstract) annotated class may be declared that way. The annotated class must have a zero-parameter constructor.

    • Required Element Summary

      Required Elements 
      Modifier and Type Required Element and Description
      int storageId
      Storage ID for this object type.

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      String name
      The name of this object type.

    • Element Detail

      • storageId

        public abstract int storageId
        Storage ID for this object type. Value must be positive.

      • name

        public abstract String name
        The name of this object type.

        If equal to the empty string (default value), the simple name of the annotated Java class is used.

        Default:
        ""
